children.value: Thinking Fast and Slow in 7 Minutes
Know the difference to empower growth
Occurs when a particular value for an unknown quantity influences your estimate of that quantity.
The ease with which we can think of examples is often used to judge the frequency of events.
The fast, unconscious, automatic, error prone and everyday decision-making brain
The slow, conscious, effortful, complex decision making and reliable part of the brain
We avoid cognitive overload by breaking up current tasks into small steps to be committed to long term memory; we are naturally drawn to solutions that use as little mental effort as possible.
One of the main functions of System 2 is to monitor and control suggestions from System 1, however it is often lazy and places too much faith in intuition.
You act differently when experiencing cognitive ease vs. strain; you’ll probably make less errors when strained, but you won’t be as creative.
Always ensure that expectations set result in a pleasant surprise. Use circuit breakers here to deliver on promises.
When you are passionate about what you do, people understand. When you are obsessed, they think you're mad. That's the difference.
A minor improvement on an important task is almost always a larger opportunity than a big improvement on an ancillary one.
